intro: Rosa tomentosa var. alsingensis, commonly known as the Alsing's woolly rose, is a shrub native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and clusters of fragrant, pale pink to white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters and thrives in well-drained, acidic soils. It is often found in forested areas and rocky slopes, where it forms part of the understory vegetation. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
